<p>Hi and welcome to vRandomBites.</p>
<p>This blog is the collection of random technical notes and thoughts of a couple of technical people.</p>
<p>Some random bits of ourselves:</p>
<h1>Amine</h1>
<p>My name is Amine El Badaoui and I currently live in Aylesbury, a small town in the south east of England.</p>
<p>I have been working in the IT industry for few years now and specialise in VMware virtualisation, data centre infrastructure and cloud technologies.</p>
<p>Over the years I have obtained many industry certifications from Microsoft, Netapp and VMware.</p>
<p>I currently work as a VMware Product Engineer @ <a href="https://www.rackspace.com/">https://www.rackspace.com/</a></p>
<p>This blog represents my random technical notes and thoughts. The thoughts expressed here do not reflect my current employer in any way.</p>
<p><b>VMware</b></p>
<ul>
<li>VCA, VCP 5/6, VCP Cloud, VCAP DCV, VCAP-DCD, VCIX, VCP-NV, vSAN Specialist, vROPS Specialist</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Netapp</b></p>
<ul>
<li><b> </b>Netapp Certified Data Administrator</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Symantec</b></p>
<ul>
<li>Netbackup Administrator</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Microsoft</b></p>
<ul>
<li>MCSA Windows 2012, MCITP Server Administrator Windows 2008 / MCTP Server Virtualisation. MCITP Exchange 2010. MCSE / MCSA Windows 2000/2003 Messaging. MCITP Enterprise Support.</li>
</ul>
<h1>Ricardo</h1>
<p>My name is Ricardo Ad√£o and I finally accepted my friend Amine challenge to start blogging some of my random pieces of "wisdom".I have been working in the IT industry for more years than I feel comfortable to admit.<br />
My journey through IT covers Software Development, Security, Network and for the last couple of years Virtualization and VMware was the main area of focus.I currently work as a VMware Product Engineer @<a href="https://www.rackspace.com/">Rackspace</a>. My posts in this blog represent my random technical notes and thoughts. The thoughts expressed here do not reflect my current employer in any way.</p>
